children.subject: 186 is a high workload and very difficult course. People can excel with this schedule, but I wouldn't recommend this schedule for anyone.

In my opinion, this seems like a higher workload than your current semester, though only slightly. CS 162 is generally considered to be a higher workload than CS 161; in my experience, CS 170 and EE 126 had similar workloads but EE 126 had more difficult concepts (difficulty of concept-wise, I would even argue EE 126 has been my hardest class) so it takes more time to parse through the information and understand it; CS 188 and CS 186 are similar in workload (this may be different for different people). If you want to get the most out of the classes, I would not recommend taking all 3. But, given your current schedule and how you are finding it, I think you will find the classes hard and time-consuming, but not impossible.

history.content: Thoughts on this schedule for next semester? For reference, I got an A in CS 70 and CS 61C, and I'm currently taking CS 170, CS 161, and CS 188 and finding it to be a reasonable time commitment. That being said, I realize that 162 is a very high workload class and 126 isn't exactly light. I have a solid team for 162, so if I were to put off a class it would be either of 126 or 186 but I'd also like to take CS 189 next spring and would preferably take 126 before then, though Prof. Shewchuck doesn't list it as a prerequisite.
history.subject: CS 162 + EECS 126 + CS W186 workload
